definition: to wrap up/to pack/to bind up (a wound)
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
to tie/to bind/classifier for flowers, banknotes etc: bundle/Taiwan pr. [zha2]

sentences.english: Wrap from the lower part of outdoor unit to the position where the duct bundle passes through the wall.
sentences.chinese: 包紮時，應從室外機下部一直包到管束入牆處。

sentences.english: A nurse cleaned and bandaged the wound.
sentences.chinese: 護士把傷口清洗包紮好。

sentences.english: And the glass cannula was more suitable than adhesive bandages for enswathement .
sentences.chinese: 玻璃套管法包紮的效果較創可貼法爲好且更爲簡便。

sentences.english: She held his hand and wrapped the soft handkerchief round it.
sentences.chinese: 她抓着他的手，用柔軟的手帕把他包紮了起來。

sentences.english: She put a dressing on the mangled toe.
The nurse had disinfected the wound before she bandaged it.
sentences.chinese: 護士包紮傷口前先進行了消毒。

sentences.english: The nurse carefully bandaged his wound.
sentences.chinese: 護士仔細包紮了他的傷口。

sentences.english: Combeferre, wearing an apron, was dressing the wounds.
sentences.chinese: 公白飛腰間圍着圍腰，在包紮傷員。

sentences.english: The doctor taped up the cut in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 醫生用繃帶包紮了他手上的傷口。

sentences.english: After wrapping with sterile gauze, the rats were feed separately.
sentences.chinese: 處理完畢後以無菌紗布包紮傷口，動物置於單籠飼養。

sentences.english: The wound was bound up by bandage.
The nurse will bind up Ed's sprained ankle.
sentences.chinese: 護士將用繃帶包紮艾德扭傷的足踝。

sentences.english: Injuries the gate not to bite sutures or the wrap.
The doctor has taped up my swollen ankle.
sentences.chinese: 醫生用繃帶把我腫起的腳踝包紮起來。

sentences.english: I bandage his knuckles, which is hard with these claws I have.
sentences.chinese: 我用繃帶包紮他被我爪子弄傷的指關節。

sentences.english: Be sure that you cleanse the wound before bandaging it.
sentences.chinese: 在你包紮傷口請確認已經弄乾淨了。

definition: to abrade/to scrape/to chafe/to graze/abrasion/friction burn/scratch
to break the door down and enter (idiom)
to sew together/suture (in surgery)/to sew up (a wound)
